title: Password reset app doesnt work
text:
UPDATE:  try your old password again, looks like they reverted back their server.  My app works again.  They did a new app update last nite but im not doing it yet!! 
Had to do a force password reset on the venstar skyport account, which i was aware was going to happen.  However now the app doesnt login, i enter the credentials and it attempts to login but then goes back to the homepage.  At least i can go in via the web browser.  Do they not test this? Uninstalling reinstalling did nothing.

title: Improved app
text: We have three of these thermostats installed in a commercial setting. I have always had to go on to a PC to make changes to the schedules. I emailed tech-support a year ago and asked that all of the features of the online portal be added to the app. For example the ability to edit the weekly schedule. Silly it wasn’t originally on there. It has taken them a long time but I think this is a very good direction. We are able to adjust  schedules from the app and everything is working really well. Bravo!

title: New Skyport App same issues
text:
My old Source1 Skyport app stopped working last week.  After hours of resetting and trying every which way to get it to work, I emailed Venstar to see we needed to get the Venstar app.    I was told to sign into it and I was again able to control my thermostat from my IPad and IPhone.  That is until today.  The app shows my thermostat is offline.    The thermostat shows being connected to my WiFi but 0 signal strength.  Why?
Other things that run on wifi are getting a signal so that is not the issue.  
This is really an annoyance for us.  I’ll wait until morning to see if it corrects itself.  If not I will again reset to factory setting and start all over again.  I should not have to keep doing this.

title: Nice To Have
text: Not sure why all the bad reviews. This app has worked well for me most of the time. There are sometimes when I have connection issues but not often. I have 3 colortouch wifi thermostats over two locations. My biggest issue with this app is when I adjust the thermostat manually on the app then try to reset it back to normal schedule it doesn’t seem to work well.I normally will have to reset the the actual thermostat when I’m home to ensures it’s running the schedule properly.

title: Love this app!
text: This is a great app!  It is very easy to navigate and I really like how I can view my systems run times and energy consumption.  I have found myself using this app to control my thermostat much more than I thought I would.  There are times when I’m perfectly comfortable but my wife may find herself a little too hot or cold and change the temperature on me. I can simply pull out my phone or tablet, open the app and change it back to where it was and she is none the wiser!

title: No connection
text:
Have had the unit for a year. Today it suddenly disconnected from the internet. I checked the setting and it is still connected to the WiFi.  All my other devices are still connected and working properly. 

I restarted the unit and it connected to the WiFi, but not Skyport.  Proceeded to their home page and I can’t log in there either.  I get a msg saying to check the server.  I think something might be wrong with their server. 

The unit is still working properly, I’m just unable to control it from my phone anymore.  Isn’t that kind of why it’s connected to WiFi?  Hope I get a response from them so I can fix the issues.

Update. 
Up and running fine. Able to log back in.  The unit is now connected to Skyport

title: Home owner
text:
So far I am a bit disappointed with the software
It constantly asked for entering of my password to access my thermostat.
Just recently a update 6.6 was introduced which now makes it more difficult to access my Thermostat I reloaded the software but it continually asking for 6.6 update without referring to the correct action to perform and would not accept my password.
This need to be resolved since I am out of the country and would like control my thermostat.
I will try to contact Venstar. Another think which frustrates me is that any nick name is being rejected when you send a feedback or rating.

title: Overall app is ok but password requirements is obnoxious
text: I constantly have to reset my password because I cannot remember it due to the fact that every single password I want to use they shut down!! I’m using upper case lower case symbols and numbers and it’s not good enough. It’s ridiculous and I want to smash the garbage  system with a hammer over and over. I just want to be able to use my garage

title: Love this app
text: I really liked the original app, but love this new one! It’s so nice to be able to turn off our system from my phone when it’s been left on after we leave the house. The new app is even easier and simpler to use than the previous version. Less jumping around to access the same features! Thanks Venstar!

title: Venstar is doing great things
text: I have 2 of these thermostats and now with the app, have control from wherever i am. Have just enabled geofencing so thermostat will go into “away” automatically. Now, Perhaps the developers could look at the app a little more - it is draining my iPhone battery.

title: Fix it!!
text: This app has been sucking lately! It’s always telling me “failed to send to thermostat” when there’s no issue with the wifi or connection! It’s so frustrating. I depend on this app to adjust the thermostat, from upstairs, in the middle of the night every single night. It has performed perfectly for almost the last three years until it started acting up a couple months ago (maybe more, maybe less... I can’t be 100% sure). Please return this to working order!

title: Perfect!
text: New app has more functions with quicker response. You can add thermostats quicker and gives more info on the home screen. The ability to check sensors and other trouble shooting functions is nice. This app is very user friendly and a must have with any of your Wi-Fi capable Venstar stats!

title: This app is making me take a hike
text: The app says I have to reset my password and tells me to check my email for further instructions. I am not receiving an email, so I’m stuck. I can’t do anything except walk all the way downstairs to change the temperature on my thermostat. ;) I do wish they’d make the password requirements less stringent and would make sure email correspondence is timely enough to save me when I really do need remote access to my thermostat.

title: Fix this app!
text:
This app is designed terribly — the functionality is a disaster. It’s fine if all you have to do is change the temp. But trying to set up for more than one device, it’s a complete mess. I’ve tried dozens of times to do some completely basic tasks, such as have the correct location with the correct thermostat. And much more. I’m out of patience. 

First bad review I’ve ever written. It bothers me that much! And, I’m good with technology, so that says a lot.

title: Great recent improvements
text: The latest update seems to have corrected a lot of the issues that were mentioned previously. Great job listening to the customer and adjusting!

title: AMAZING APP
text:
I have been using this app for quite a few years now, this app has not once disappointed me!! It is fast, friendly and super easy to use. The crew over at Venstar is killing it!! Thank you for making this app easy to use for the not so tech savvy!!

James D. Reel

title: Stopped working since last update
text: Was finicky. But worked for the most part. Until last update 6.9. Can’t even log in to the website. Keeps getting redirected to sign in page on both the app and website. Please fix.

title: App is very “glitchy”
text: I do love having the app but sometimes it works sometimes it does not.  I have learned to not depend on it but when it’s working it is great.  In the last year I have had to delete the app and download again 4 separate times.  Maybe it will get better.

title: Stylish with functionality
text: This app is amazing with so many live features. It allows me to control my Venstar T7850 with ease and all the functions right at my finger tips. Great products controlled by a stylish up-to-date app. Would recommend!

title: Nothing but Problems
text: I loved the previous apps. They worked great. Since I update the app about a week ago I have had nothing but problems. On the previous app you would change the temp and hit send to sync it with the thermostat. The send button no longer appears on my app when I change the temp so when I change the temp it doesn't sync with my thermostat.  I even tried deleting the app and reinstalling it.

title: App isn’t worth the space on your phone
text: Out of the 100s of times I’ve tried to change my temperature or do anything on this app, I can count on one hand that I didn’t receive the “Failed to send to thermostat” message. It’s completely useless. I sent an email to their support a month ago and still haven’t heard back. Completely useless, both the app & company.

title: Like app except keep having to change passwords
text: The app works well but every time there is a new version, we have to change our password.  This is a thermostat for crying out loud, not bank accounts or top secret info.

title: Having issues with opening the app
text: Not sure what happened but now I have to open the app and then close it again for it to work. App needs some work.

title: Just make the app work please
text: The app won’t work. Well I actually don’t know because it won’t let me sign on. It says the password is not correct. I try to update my password and it crashes. I like the thermostat but the app really leaves a lot to be desired. Should I just switch to a nest?

title: Fingerprint please!
text: Love the app and it works well for my needs. So tired of having to type out login info every time. Can’t you set up fingerprint or facial recognition??

title: Constant request for password now
text:
One of the recent releases has started asking for password on a too regular basis.  Either raise the interval or start using biometric thumbprint or facial recognition.  

Really reduces quick usefulness of app.

title: Useless most of the time
text: The app goes offline for no apparent reason and remains that way for long periods. I’ve tried deleting and reloading the app. Nothing. And the developer doesn’t seem to care one iota. No response. No change. People who give this app 5 stars are bots.

title: Stopped working
text: Last version stopped working ok iPhone 8. At sign on after entering credentials the whole screen blinks and freezes.

title: No working sign in page
text: The one page I can see now is the sign in page, that does not work at all. Used to work great but is now worthless. Maybe someone should have spent at least a minute to test....

title: Always asks for password!
text: Come on developers!!, enable keychain, facial recognition, or any of the many available (and secure) features to avoid having to enter a password every single time we launch the app.  This is a small but necessary enhancement to an otherwise fairly decent app.

title: Stopped working
text: This app is horrible and needs to be updated. Randomly stops working and won’t let you sign in even after deleting and reinstalling. Needs an update now!

title: Useless pile
text: Useless pile of garbage. The account creation/login is one of the worst and after activating my account I had to restart my password multiple times and verify the account only to not be able to log in.

title: Buy different thermostats
text: These stink, always going offline, the password requirements are ridiculous. It’s a thermostat for Christ’s sake.  Poor toggling between multiple thermostats.

title: A yea ago
text: I really need to compare what my unit has been doing. Not just 3 months out

title: Need updates software
text: Every 2-3 months disconnected thermostat. I have to reconnecting again wasting my time 1-2 hours keep trying.  The Apps software need to be update it.

title: Useless
text: About a week ago the app started saying the thermostat is not connected to WiFi when it is. Tried deleting the app and reconnecting to WiFi. Still doesn’t work.

title: Can’t login
text: After latest update, I can’t log back in and when I try to reset password I’ve got the not valid email message!!!! What’s going on ?!?!

title: New update not great
text: A week ago I updated the app. I’ve had nothing but trouble since.

title: Terrible app
text: Constantly having issues and contact info is very difficult to find to resolve. I like the thermostat but hate the app!

title: Great update!
text: I love the new Venstar app allows for me to add more thermostats!  Thank you!!

title: Can't even log in
text: I don't know anything about the app since it hangs every time I try to log in. App is garbage, not worth your time

title: Face ID
text: A new version and still no support that I can see for Face ID on iOS. Pick up the pace please. This is way overdue.

title: Flickers
text:
App keeps signing me out and have to reset password
Also app flickers

title: It doesn’t even work
text: It would work if I could login at least

title: Crash
text: App keeps crashing after update

title: App fails to work
text: After the security enhancements, cannot use app on iPhone.  One star review is one star too generous.

title: Security Reset
text: Even after multiple attempts the app kicks me out.  Can’t login.

title: Can’t log back in. Fix it!
text: App locked me out and now I can’t log back into it. Fix it now!

title: No Longer Words
text: The new app doesn’t work with my older iphone. I would like to  reinstall version 5.2. How can I do that?

title: Offline
text: My thermostat was not connect with my app

title: Works but terrible UI
text: Gets the job done, but the UI leaves much to be desired. Half the screen is used up for an error message stating that the weather for my location is not available (... and why anyone would care to see the weather forecast in this app anyways bewilders me). My major gripe is that when I want to tell a 'location' that I am either away or home, I have to go through each thermostat at that location, go to the 'configure' section for each thermostat, and set that thermostat as away or home. Shouldn't the 'away or home' setting be set for a 'location' instead on each 'thermostat'? Makes no sense to me.

title: Connected, but not like Nest.
text:
Take a look at the Nest app. So pretty, so useful, so easy. Now take a look at your app: old, outdated, and lacking functionality. I give it three stars, because yes, you can change your thermostats' temperatures and mode from anywhere, but you can't alter schedules, set what vacation mode does, or see whole-house runtimes. Unlike nests, your thermostats do not learn from the user's to save energy while keeping us cool, and they are boxy and unattractive on the walls. Better than standard thermostats, but not as good as a Nest or an Ecobee. Start taking cues from Nest, Venstar, and I will love you.

This doesn't even mention rookie mistakes: we set our screens to fully dimmed (off) while we don't use them, and messages do not make the backlight turn on, so you wouldn't notice a message until—by chance—we get up and change the temperature. We don't see messages or alerts for days!! So make it light up on incoming alerts/messages. And we still can't see the outside temp on our 3-year-old connected ColorTouch?

title: Simple, Functional, and works smoothly
text: People complaining about the app being outdated and needing their hand held every step of the way are missing the point of this app with this stat. If I want the outside temp I can check another app, or walk outside. I love my T8750, it works flawlessly from my phone to my system with the shortest response time I've seen yet. I wanted wifi for the convenience to change temps on my phone, I chose Venstar because it works without all the smart BS that goes along in learning stats. We have a Bryant Evolution Connex system and that is the smartest stat on the market and the biggest pain, when it learns it takes control, this gives it back to us. Thank you for a functional product that provides the user with ease and control over their system.

title: This is an excellent iPhone app it will let you do most everything you would want to do with the the
text:
Using with the Venstar T3800 and the Venstar ACC-VWF1 WIFI module.

Allows me to monitor and control my Venstar T3800 thermostat from anywhere in the world using my iPhone.  The Venstar app is simple to use without a lot of unnecessary fluff. With the iPhone app, you can raise or lower the temperature, change the thermostat from Heating, Cooling or Auto, and control the fan (aka blower) independently if you wish. 

The iPhone app will also let you observe the running time of your equipment. The Venstar Skyport iPhone app allows you to have up to 10 different properties, with up to 10 thermostats at each property.

I LOVE the red/green LED indicator on the Venstar thermostat, it is a unique feature that I simply cannot live without.   (The LED indicator allows me to know what the thermostat is doing laying in bed with just one eye open. )

I had occasion to send their technical support a question. I received a courteous and useful answer (in perfect English), about 12 hours later.

title: Supper app!
text: Love it, best control I have found for the $. Please add a hole house lower/raise. I have 5 in my house and I would like to lower all of them together when we leave for awhile on the weekends.  Thanks!  The The history function is very interesting but the way it's displayed is irrelevant because it's day so far and week so far compared to all of last week which is Irrelevant. If it was based on more of an accrual system like week to date then you would have something to compare it to.  Being able to adjust the schedule on your iPhone would be extremely helpful. Still the best app thermostat interface I've found!!

title: No problems, mostly intuitive
text:
We replaced two thermostats with Venstar ColorTouch. The app works perfectly and connects without issue to thermostats whenever I have an Internet connection. We spent $ on new thermostats mostly to have reliable wifi control and the app interface has not disappointed. 

Two suggestions: 1. When it's nighttime, don't display the sun to depict a clear sky. It's 2015 and apps shouldn't need this kind of refinement. 2. With two thermostats on our account I find the toggling between the two a tad awkward and less than intuitive. 

These are quibbles, though. We love the thermostats and the app overall. Highly recommended.

title: If it ain’t broke...
text:
Whilst I appreciate you trying to improve the “hip” look of the UI, it doesn’t seem worth it when the actual UI is messed with and confuses the user! Why would you unnecessarily change such a simple thing as the “Cancel” and “Send” buttons, for example, by reversing them?

After so long having the green “send” to be on the left, it’s frustrating having it suddenly change to the right for no apparent reason. I keep canceling my adjustment requests instead of sending them. Also, it was so much easier to see the runtimes and there was more info previously available.

title: Not Bad, But Not Amazing
text:
I was excited to get this installed.  Now that I have it up and running, I can confirm what others are saying about the lack of ability to make changes from the app. It's better than nothing at all, that's for sure!

My dad has the Nest and he was showing off all that he can do with his. Not going to lie, I was a bit jealous! However, I got this brand new in the box for $110 on EBay and that's a steal! For what I paid, I will use it and not complain. It was a wonderful upgrade to my old Honeywell thermostat!

title: Don’t waste your time or money
text:
The app is HORRIBLE. If you are thinking you will be able to control the thermostat/temperature remotely outside of your home - it does not work. I constantly have to delete the app and reinstall and even then I’m lucky if it work 1/8 of the time. 
I have to purchase something different as my animals are being affected badly when I can not turn the AC on from work. 
I will never buy anything less than a Nest Thermostat as I never had any problems in my last home with that one. 
Best part. They ask for a “nickname” to post this review but won’t allow ANY nicknames as they are ALL taken. 
Even random letters are apparently ALL taken. What a joke!

title: Was nice, now "broken"
text:
As others mentioned, the application is limited in functionality. You can alter temp settings, switch to away mode when not at home, etc

However, something happened to the app a few months ago - the app no longer communicates with the thermostat unless you restart it every day. The thermostat will not respond to any changes from the app. Very frustrating

title: Venstar for t5800
text: This app is good in the sense that you can adjust the temperature, adjust fan (off, auto, or on only)or place the thermostat in schedule or vacation mode. However,it is limited insofar as you cannot view or program the schedules or smart fan or other settings remotely as the competitors allow. You can only turn"on" vacation mode or schedule mode but cannot view the schedule or edit over wifi through app. Hopefully venstar is planning an update to make this a 5 star app with greater functionality.

title: Power duo!
text:
Great app to go with a great product. This app is user friendly and really has some great features... I'm especially fond of the message feature. An easy way to send yourself a reminder, or someone at home a nice little note!

My home is my happy place, so the more comfortable and efficient I can make it, the more I can enjoy it! Knowing that I am saving energy (and money) doesn't hurt either!... It's a win, win!

title: Pretty good for v 1.0 (Updated)
text:
First off the app has great features and a wonderful user interface.

Only problem is that I constantly get error messages telling me I cannot connect to Skyport services. Both my iPad and the WiFi key are getting 75% or better signal. I have the same issue with the iPhone app as well.

Second item is that the screen rotation for iPad does not work. It seems to only display in one landscape orientation. 

The web based app works well if you're having issue as above.

Fix the connectivity issues and this would be 5 star app.

UPDATE:
Connection issues seemed to be resolved!  Might have been on the back end since I didn't have to update my app.  Thanks for the great  work!

title: Great app 👍
text:
Great App! Easy to install and simple to use. 

I have one concern:
The skyport service froze the thermostat once and locked out my unit. It was a simple fix (unplug the thermostat from wall and plug it back in to reset) but what if I am out of town for a few days and I am unable to manually reset the T-stat? Needs to have some sort of remote reset or auto-reset when this happens.  Other than that it's awesome!😃

title: Easy
text: This is an app that is actually useful and it works! When you purchase the Color Touch thermostat spend a few more dollars and get the wifi card. Once installed you have control over your heating and air from your mobile devices or your computer. Turn it on before you get home. Turn it off when you leave. Awesome!!

title: A change for the better!
text: I don't do reviews often.  I normally hate software changes because new bugs usually come along for the ride.   This update is great. I particularly like the new placement and one stop shop for the manual fan now on the same page with the other functions. You did real fine on this update. Thanks!

title: What happened to my app.
text:
I once loved this app. From the main screen I was able to easily turn my air or heater off and on. Today I go to use my app and something changed. Those options have now been removed. So because of that I am giving 1 star. Hope they fix this soon.

Looks like they fixed it. Within a day of my review my app looked correct. So I am going from 1 star to 4 stars.

title: Works great, simple controls at your fingertips
text: I've been using this app for 2 years without issue. Occasionally but rarely I'll lose connectivity due to a wifi issue. It would be nice if  capability to adjust more settings from app instead of stat only gets added. If it ain't broke, don't fix it I guess. It's one of the only apps I have that doesn't require annoyingly constant updates.

title: New app UI lacks UX
text: The menu bar at the bottom for “away”, “home”, “schedule”, etc, make your temperature setting to be reset to uncomfortable temperature values. Not to mention it is really easy to accidentally hit those buttons. That menu needs to get the temperature reset issue fixed (recall last temp setting) and moved out of the way. Perhaps above the commonly used buttons just below the weather and info bar. This having to wake up at 3 am because the temp was reset to 63 deg Accidentally is getting really old. Honeywell products are becoming very appealing...

title: Best Wi-Fi Thermostat App
text: You guys did a killer job on this first release!  I'm able to control all of my thermostats, receive alarms for filter, low temperature, and other conditions, view my Energy Usage, and even Text Message my thermostat!  I can't believe you're making all of this available for free, keep up the great work Venstar!!

title: Amazingly poor execution
text: This is just a company showing how they are asleep at the wheel.   Major brands have made app enabled thermostats easy to use. You have to use a web app to set most functions including critical alerts such as high temp. They only use email, no push notifications.   The website isn’t mobile friendly so get back to your desktop or laptop my friends.  I have used other connected tstats and this is embarrassing for a company of this size.  They clearly place no importance to this project.

title: Great product
text: I purchased this thermostat for my houseboat. I live 90 minutes away from the lake. I can turn the air on in the morning and by the time I get there the boat is cool. Before I used to get to the boat and when it' s 90 degrees outside the boat would be 100 degrees inside, and take most of the day to cool Down. Love,love,love it!

title: Love the functionality but outdoor info is incorrect
text: Really, really love being able to change the thermostat from any iOS device!!!! But, Venstar needs to get a better temperature feed from the web. I am not sure what they are using but they are currently 6 degrees off from the National Weather Service temperature, which is just too much variance. I would give 5 stars if this was fixed.

title: Home monitor
text: I have people in my home that like to "play" with he thermostat so this gives me the ability to monitor and change the set points without having to be there at all. Plus, if I'm heading home and Need to set the temp to occupied because nobody is home then it's done, easy as pie.

title: Great Thermostat app needs more features.
text: All the basics are there, but would be nice to control a little more of the thermostats features. The number one feature is the ability to rotate the application! Having a horizontally wall mounted tablet, this is a necessity.

title: LOVE IT
text: This app works great, I can control my thermostat from anywhere. Love being able to turn up the heat on my way back from being out of town. Also I can adjust the heat, using the iphone app, without getting out of bed. Nice! Easy to use, too.

title: Not working since iOS update
text: The app does not open and just goes to a black screen since the latest iOS update. Also my notifications are all off for Venstar but if I double tap the home button there is a message from Venstar telling me good morning at the bottom of my screen that does not go away and is permanently there.

title: Amazing product, Cool App!
text: Very smart interface to my home thermostats.  Already saved big $$$ on my utility bill from remote locations by being able to control the stat on my iPhone.  Love the messaging feature and the usage reports!

title: Nice app if it still worked.
text: When I first installed this app it worked just fine.  The last three versions, however, do not seem to allow you to stay logged in.  After downloading the most recent update, I logged in immediately but was kicked out in less than 30 seconds. Repeated attempts to log back in get a cute little message "Opps, something went wrong!"  It is a shame, and it makes me want to not buy any more of their thermostats.

title: What a pitiful junk!
text:
Mi doubt any of these negative reviews will improve this app, since so many people have complained and the problems just keep getting worse, but I’m lending my disgust to these piece of crap app as well. Have to sign in each time it updates.  No other app
I’ve ever used requires that. On top of that the app won’t connect to the thermostat for quite a long while after update. I will be moving soon, but will never buy another Venstar for my home.

title: Perfect solution
text: Installed flawlessly on the first try. Controls all functions remotely in a simple, easy to understand format from iPhone/iPad.  It's clear that a lot of thought went into the design. It just works.

title: Amazing app, u gotta get this
text: This app works great. Not only can I adjust my thermostat from anywhere, but I also get to see how often my A/C is running.  It's also pretty cool that I can send my thermostat pop-up messages. You gotta get one of these.

title: Stopped working
text: I’ve been using this app on my iPhone for several years suddenly today it’s stopped connecting absolutely no reason why it stopped I have strong Wi-Fi signal that is not the problem it’s got to be on the Venstar side. No changes were made to my phone so that cannot be the problem

title: Best thermostat
text:
Best thermostat and best app what I ever ever see and use. Thermostat response time is unbelievable just tap on you phone and right away. Amazing. A+++
Only thing what is missing is L wire to communicate with outdoor unit. Except that is best thermostat. Highly recommend.

title: Venstar Skyport
text: This control and associated software is very basic and even lacks some very basic features. How can a schedule run if the clock can’t be set properly. We have had three different techs from the company that installed our heating/ac system try to set it up. I’ve looked at to the point that I’m tired of looking at it. Now I will replace this brand new control with one that will actually perform properly.

title: The Skyport Cloud is Awesome
text: I wish that the functionality of the skyport cloud was accessible through the app because I do not receive a full display of the skyport cloud when viewing it through safari on my iPhone. If the app provided more controls, like the skyport cloud, I probably would rate 5 stars.

title: Exceptionally terrible
text:
It’s hard to pull of an application as terrible as this one, but props to you for doing it. Hitting the home button, turns the system off.  hitting the Schedule button, turns off the schedule. Want to set a schedule or change some settings? Not supported 

Keep it up, I’m rooting for the team to continue on this path of terribleness so that I can keep laughing at my bad financial decisions.

title: Too Basic
text: App only permits to change temp up or down. Does not allow programming of daily schedules. Apparently have to do that on the website.  Once done on website I don't know if can change schedule on app.  I have 4 Honeywells and all work beautifully with their app. Very disappointed, considering returning.

title: Add ability to set the schedule from the app
text: The touch screen is so so on the thermostat and often misses or double presses on taps. It would be nice to be able to set the schedule from this app rather than the thermostat. Adding the ability to configure other thermostat settings would not hurt either

title: Works great
text: Works fantastic for my vacation home. We can heat up our cabin in the winter before we arrive. Also allows us to keep a eye on the temp inside when it's cold.

title: Awesome app
text: Now I can control my thermostat anywhere! Works great on both my iPhone and iPad. I take my phone everywhere, so energy savings and zoning is always within reach.

title: New Version
text: Finally a new version of the app has been released. Seems easier to use but I can no longer turn on/off the Vacation Schedule. I hope it will be added back in on the next release. Soon.

title: Can’t change alerts?
text: Please make it possible to toggle alerts on and off in the new app. Or change the interface so I can figure out how. Or add a note the it’s not possible!

title: Great Product
text: I love this App. I can control my Venstar T5800 from anywhere in the world now. Great for making sure my dog stays comfortable all day and also great for pre-cooling on my way home.

title: More options?
text: It would be nice to have more options, like making changes to the schedule or even having the ability to have control of the overall settings on the thermostat  within the app. That would be a great idea!!!!

title: It's Basic, outdated as all hell...
text:
Minimalist app and basic...
Update format and capabilities.  The app should be able to do anything the thermostat can do, just short of settings.  Not just turn on and off heat and cold. 
Get Apple Watch capability, like everything else is, keep up or get left behind.

title: Total Control of my HVAC at my fingertips
text: This app is awesome!!!  It's clean UI and simplicity makes it a pleasure to monitor my systems. The T-stat is great all by itself but with wireless connection the system is the best on the market!!

title: Great App
text: Just installed my T5800 thermostat and added the Wi-Fi key and I love it, great app.  Friendly interface and shows my energy usage. So easy, even a caveman can do it.

title: Cool App!!
text: I have the Venstar app on my iPad & it's so convenient! It's pretty cool to see whats going on at home from my cell. And whatever changes that are made on my thermostat is update very quickly. L-O-V-E it!!!!!

title: Great App!
text: App works flawlessly. Controls and use are self explanatory. Great for temp control management while away from home. Recommend to all!

title: What happened to my sensors?
text: Why did my sensors disappear, do I have to re program everything now? Why would you change something that is working and your customers were familiar and comfortable with.

title: Love this!!!
text: I always forget to turn off the heater or A/C when I'm running out of the house. Now I can control the thermostat from my phone. Sooo cool!!!!! I love it!!!!

title: Buggy and feature poor
text: Website is flawless but app has trouble finding all devices. Very limited configuration. Hope for new version soon.

title: Worked as promised - waiting on watch app
text: Yes the app works but the reason I went with this product over the nest etc., was the product media shows it working on the Apple Watch. Two years later still shows it in the product media and no watch all. So 1 Star.

title: Was Great, What Changed
text: Installed this thermostat and App about a month ago, and it's been flawless until today. Suddenly very buggy and unreliable connectivity.

title: Does not work on iPhone 6s Plus
text: It worked once and then never again. There is no problem using a browser on the iPhone or the computer, however, the app does not function. Very very disappointed.

title: Great App, Great Product!
text: Great app that's fully functional and responsive! Does everything I need it to!

title: Old app was great, new one terrible
text: More difficult to track usage over multiple thermostats.  Also lost the ability to view multiple thermostat status at once on the hone page.  Please bring back the old app!

title: Thermostat app Offline after iOS Upgrade
text: Since upgrading my iPhone to IOS 8.1.1 the Venstar app, when activated, indicates that my thermostat is offline. My thermostat is working manually, but it's on the ground floor and I am on the third. How much longer will it take for Venstar to fix this problem? #BugFixNow

title: 👍 EZ Remote Monitoring
text: Wife likes the house warm. I like it cool. I have the app. She does not. Always 72F when we get home from work. I love it!

title: No communication with thermostat
text: Horrible app. I can control the thermostat just fine via the website, but can only view what my thermostat is doing with the app. That is not why I purchased this thermostat! Come on now, you can do better than this.

title: WiFi never connected
text: Thermostats don’t connect to internet. Both used to and now both don’t. Tried numerous times to fix. Gave up!

title: Love it
text: I absolutely love this app. I will be offering this to my clients ASAP. Works with no issues at all. 5 stars!

title: Not bad. Needs improvements
text: I should be able to send photos to the thermostat instead of using the SD card.

title: Fantastic
text: Works great for me. Can't wait till it works with Apple Watch.

title: Still buggy
text: Outside temperature is always wrong. It says 15 but we never go that low here in california. There are times i can't sign in to turn my schedule off when i'm miles away from home.

title: Pointless
text: The app always tells me it can’t complete the command. Half the time the screen is messed up and I can’t read the temperature because it’s displaying code. I can’t even get the schedule to work, or the Home/Away feature to work. Why do I even have this if i still have to manually adjust everything on the wall display; instead of being able to do it remotely?

title: Update desperately needed
text: I have not been able to use this app for over 24 hours; can’t adjust the temperature and now it won’t even let me log in. Please fix this bug ASAP

title: What happened?
text:
Upgrade no longer lets you stay logged in so you have to sign in each time. Password requirements are too stringent. 
Please fix!!!

title: Disappointed
text: I have two wireless venstar stats and I have to redo the setup everyday due to it dropping offline. Even bought a wifi range extender. I wouldn't recommend to anyone.

title: Latest Update
text: I can no longer connect to my equipment since last update. Please fix and I will change my rating

title: App frequently forgets login details
text: I just love being asked for my password as I’m headed home when all I want to do is turn on the air.

title: No longer works
text: The latest app + OS no longer changes temperature up or down! The temp setting is frozen. The app is antiquated in appearance functionality.

title: Great APP!
text: Easy to use and no monthly fee...perfect!

title: Cool App
text: This app is awesome. The future of Air Conditioning is right here with this app!

title: Dies not work
text: Why the app does not work anymore?

title: Confusing
text:
The new UI update is so confusing.
How do I enable/disable schedule?  The schedule button is not clickable

title: Always have to sign in
text: I have to sign in everyone I use this app. It wastes time. Just keep me signed in.

title: It just works, could care less about GUI
text:
After reading a few reviews I was a little concerned about the app. We are a home automation company that uses or own control app to control all of the systems within the clients home.

This home is different in that it is a second home and it is not feasible to control two different instances of the app on a clients phone.

While not at the home we have given the clients control over alarm, locks, garage doors and now the thermostats using the manufactures native app.

Yes we have used all manner and brand of thermostats but have never set up the Venstar’s using the Skyport app. Prepared for the “first time” problems we scheduled extra time for the learning curve.

There was non, this was by far and away the easiest to get on line (Wi-Fi) set up the app, and than get the 4 different units configured for both the control system and the native app.

As far as the graphics, we not the clients care, and that’s from a company (ours) that have graphic designer on staff. It’s about control and being able to use there from anywhere.

As far as the scheduling, it’s there, vacation mode there and the website interface was easy to use and had a lot of information about run times per unit.

We use the Venstar thermostats on 90% of our jobs (about 70 per year) and have never had an issue less one out of the box bad Wi-Fi card. I can’t say the same of other brands mentioned in other reviews.

One last note, we make no money on the units as they are sold and installed by the HVAC contractors. We are able to sell and profit from others but it’s not worth the service calls and angry clients when the manufacture bricks there units in January during a “firmware update”

Just sayin

title: Always offline
text: I wish I could give this app a fraction of a star

title: Great app
text: Works exactly as described! Very useful

title: Not keeping up
text: Was working ok. Nothing fancy but since iOS update totally nonfunctional.

title: THE best thermostat everrr!!!
text:
Super easy to use!!
Best good looking tstat!!
Most options!!
Greatest screensavers!!
Best gift idea for friends and family!!
Love, love, love!!

title: Help!
text: Doesn’t work with updated IOS software

title: Why did y’all change App
text: Now I can’t turn-off my Heater with iPhone or iPad 🤬

title: Quit on us
text: It just quit. For no reason. Why don’t they fix this??????

title: Outdated. Old. Functions.
text:
This app is in serious need of updating to a modern UI/UX, iOS 12 and X/Xs/Max/r support.

Get’er done!

title: Sky port
text: Application crash. No communication with sky port server. iPhone, Samsung and Ipod

title: What happened?
text: It used to have the ability to set a pass code to lock out unauthorized users, and it use to have an “auto setting”, not just hot or cold. Not a very efficient app.

title: Unable to connect to skyport or wifi
text: Save yourself the problems and time and just buy a Nest!!! Venstar literally has issues weekly, I am constantly unable to connect the thermometer to wifi when my internet in the home is extremely fast and in working order. My dad has same issues with his Venstar thermostat and app as well. Every week we get an error code or the app shows “thermometer is offline”. Just very cheap and outdated system, that probably nobody ever monitors or updates. Everyone I know who has a nest never has these connectivity issues.

title: Terrible
text: This app is so bad I had to leave a review.  It has a ton of bugs.  It will sign you out and won’t let you sign in.  The password is correct as I can sign in through a web browser into the account.  It’s probably the worst and most frustrating app I’ve ever used.  Especially considering how simple this should be to code.  They need to fire the lead who was in charge of this code and redo it.  Absolute garbage.

title: Confusing in many ways
text:
The new app design is pretty, but a little confusing. As others have mentioned, 1/2 of the display is taken up with information that doesn't originate from the thermostat, at least in my case since I don't have a remote temperature sensor. That seems odd. 

On the bottom of the display is a bar that says "Disabled due to schedule", or "Disabled due to Away", but what is disabled? Why not say what it is in the message? I see from the preview photos in App Store that the bar would otherwise contain heating and cooling control buttons, but that won't be obvious if there is always a schedule set.  I suggest the message, "Manual Controls disabled due to active schedule" or "...due to Away mode".

The home button toggles between Home and Away, but is Away mode new? And if so, what are the settings for it? Does it maintain a minimum and maximum temperature? The latest version of the T2000 manual on the Venstar site is 12/17 and does not discuss Away mode in any detail.

The fan button seems to toggle between Auto and On, and yet sometimes when it switches to Auto the blade icon starts to turn, and other times it doesn't. So whatever that is trying to tell the user, the caption should change to clarify it.

When the temperature is changed it is necessary to send the changes to the thermostat, but not when the fan operation is changed. This seems inconsistent.

On my iPhone, the Venstar app was updated to the new level, and is still identified as "Venstar". But on my Android tablet the app simply disappeared, both from the device and from Play Store. Now the Venstar Skyport app seems to be the replacement there, but on the iPhone it's called "Venstar" even though it's called "Venstar Skyport" in the App Store. Very confusing!!

Some of these actions could be explained if there was a Help function in the app. A way to display the app version would help too.

title: Quit working,   Yesterday 2-12-19
text: Woohoo!  It’s working now 2-13-19!  Looks like it was updated. It’s back to normal.

title: Love It
text: This app is very easy to use, nice and simple interface. I can see if the AC or furnace is running, current temp at home, remote control temp, energy usage stats, even send text message to the thermostat.  I wish the app leave the checkmark on remember my username when i logout, still give it 5 stars

title: Great App and Product
text: Have liked all the features.  One thing of note is don't try to sign up for your account and activate your device through the app use the computer.  App doesn't ask for the 6 digit code and fails to connect.  Minor issue pleased with everything else.

title: Ridiculously easy to use!
text: Interface is awesome. Looks great, simple, no nonsense. You have complete climate control from anywhere using your iPhone or iPad. I just adjusted the thermostat from my bed using this app because I didn't want to get off my lazy butt to go down the hallway to adjust the temp. Ahhhh, technology.
